metadata.name: Azure NetApp Files
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure NetApp Files Account and the associated resource types such as backups, capacity pools and volumes.
Optional. The name of the backup vault.
Optional. The list of backups to create.
Optional. Location of the backup vault.
The type for a backup vault.
Required. The name of the capacity pool.
Optional. Location of the pool volume.
Optional. Tags for the capcity pool.
Optional. The pool service level.
Required. Provisioned size of the pool in Tebibytes (TiB).
Optional. The qos type of the pool.
Optional. List of volumes to create in the capacity pool.
Optional. If enabled (true) the pool can contain cool Access enabled volumes.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Encryption type of the capacity pool, set encryption type for data at rest for this pool and all volumes in it. This value can only be set when creating new pool.
The type for a capacity pool.
Required. The name of the snapshot policy.
Optional. Location of the snapshot policy.
Optional. Daily schedule for the snapshot policy.
Optional. Hourly schedule for the snapshot policy.
Optional. Monthly schedule for the snapshot policy.
Optional. Weekly schedule for the snapshot policy.
The type for a snapshot policy.
Optional. The name of the backup policy.
Optional. The location of the backup policy.
Optional. The daily backups to keep. Note, the maximum hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly backup retention counts _combined_ is 1019 (this parameter's max).
Optional. The monthly backups to keep. Note, the maximum hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly backup retention counts _combined_ is 1019 (this parameter's max).
Optional. The weekly backups to keep. Note, the maximum hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly backup retention counts _combined_ is 1019 (this parameter's max).
Optional. Indicates whether the backup policy is enabled.
The type for a backup policy.
Required. The name of the backup policy to link.
Required. Enable to enforce the policy.
Required. The name of the Backup Vault.
The type for the backup properties.
Optional. Replication properties.
Optional. Backup properties.
Optional. Snapshot properties.
The type for the data protection properties.
Required. Order index.
Optional. Client ingress specification as comma separated string with IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names.

Optional. This parameter specifies who is authorized to change the ownership of a file. restricted - Only root user can change the ownership of the file. unrestricted - Non-root users can change ownership of files that they own.
Optional. Allows CIFS protocol.
Optional. Has root access to volume.
Required. Kerberos5 Read only access.
Required. Kerberos5 Read and write access.
Required. Kerberos5i Read only access.
Required. Kerberos5i Read and write access.
Required. Kerberos5p Read only access.
Required. Kerberos5p Read and write access.
Required. Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes.
Required. Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes.
Required. Read only access.
Required. Read and write access.
Required. The Export policy rules.
The type for export policy rules.
Required. Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication.
Optional. The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.Required for Data Protection volumes.
Optional. The resource ID of the remote volume. Required for Data Protection volumes.
Optional. The replication schedule for the volume (to only be set on the destination (dst)).
Required. The Path to a ONTAP Host.
Required. The name of a server on the ONTAP Host.
Required. The name of a volume on the server.
Optional. The full path to a volume that is to be migrated into ANF. Required for Migration volumes.
The type for the replication properties.
Required. The name of the snapshot policy to link.
The type for the snapshot properties.
Optional. The name of the backup.
Optional. Label for backup.
Optional. The name of the snapshot.
Required. The name of the volume to backup.
Required. The name of the capacity pool containing the volume.
The type for a backup.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, the deployment will use the latest version available at deployment time.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
An AVM-aligned type for a customer-managed key. To be used if the resource type does not support auto-rotation of the customer-managed key.
Required. The daily snapshot hour.
Required. The daily snapshot minute.
Required. Daily snapshot count to keep.
Optional. Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes.
The type for a daily schedule for the snapshot policy.
Required. The hourly snapshot minute.
Required. Hourly snapshot count to keep.
Optional. Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes.
The type for an hourly schedule for the snapshot policy.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if only user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Required. Indicates which days of the month snapshot should be taken. A comma delimited string. E.g., '10,11,12'.
Required. The monthly snapshot hour.
Required. The monthly snapshot minute.
Required. Monthly snapshot count to keep.
Optional. Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes.
The type for a monthly schedule for the snapshot policy.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the pool volume.
Optional. If enabled (true) the pool can contain cool Access enabled volumes.
Optional. Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.
Optional. Determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes (Default/Never/Read).
Optional. The source of the encryption key.
Optional. The resource ID of the key vault private endpoint.
Optional. DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication.
Optional. Location of the pool volume.
Required. The Availability Zone to place the resource in. If set to 0, then Availability Zone is not set.
Optional. The pool service level. Must match the one of the parent capacity pool.
Optional. Network feature for the volume.

Optional. A unique file path for the volume. This is the name of the volume export. A volume is mounted using the export path. File path must start with an alphabetical character and be unique within the subscription.
Required. Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes.
Optional. Set of protocol types. Default value is `['NFSv3']`. If you are creating a dual-stack volume, set either `['NFSv3','CIFS']` or `['NFSv4.1','CIFS']`.
Required. The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/volumes.
Optional. Export policy rules.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enables SMB encryption. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume.
Optional. Enables continuously available share property for SMB volume. Only applicable for SMB volume.
Optional. Enables non-browsable property for SMB Shares. Only applicable for SMB/DualProtocol volume.
Optional. Define if a volume is KerberosEnabled.
Optional. The type of the volume. DataProtection volumes are used for replication.
Optional. The throughput in MiBps for the NetApp account.
The type for a volume in the capacity pool.
Required. The weekly snapshot day.
Required. The weekly snapshot hour.
Required. The weekly snapshot minute.
Required. Weekly snapshot count to keep.
Optional. Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes.
The type for a weekly schedule for the snapshot policy.
Required. The name of the NetApp account.
Optional. Name of the active directory host as part of Kerberos Realm used for Kerberos authentication.
Optional. Enable AES encryption on the SMB Server.
Optional. The customer managed key definition.
Optional. Fully Qualified Active Directory DNS Domain Name (e.g. 'contoso.com').
Optional. Required if domainName is specified. Username of Active Directory domain administrator, with permissions to create SMB server machine account in the AD domain.
Optional. Required if domainName is specified. Password of the user specified in domainJoinUser parameter.
Optional. Used only if domainName is specified. LDAP Path for the Organization Unit (OU) where SMB Server machine accounts will be created (i.e. 'OU=SecondLevel,OU=FirstLevel').

Optional. Required if domainName is specified. Comma separated list of DNS server IP addresses (IPv4 only) required for the Active Directory (AD) domain join and SMB authentication operations to succeed.
Optional. Specifies whether encryption should be used for communication between SMB server and domain controller (DC). SMB3 only.
Optional. If enabled, NFS client local users can also (in addition to LDAP users) access the NFS volumes.
Optional. Required if domainName is specified. NetBIOS name of the SMB server. A computer account with this prefix will be registered in the AD and used to mount volumes.
Optional. Capacity pools to create.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC) as part of Kerberos Realm used for Kerberos authentication.

Optional. Specifies whether to use TLS when NFS (with/without Kerberos) and SMB volumes communicate with an LDAP server. A server root CA certificate must be uploaded if enabled (serverRootCACertificate).
Optional. Specifies whether or not the LDAP traffic needs to be signed.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. A server Root certificate is required of ldapOverTLS is enabled.
Optional. Tags for all resources.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The netapp backup vault to create & configure.
Optional. The snapshot policies to create.
Optional. The backup policies to create.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]

properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('customerManagedKey'))), createObject('identity', if(not(empty(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'))), createObject('userAssignedIdentity', extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '/')[2], split(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities', last(split(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '/')))), null()), 'keySource', 'Microsoft.KeyVault', 'keyVaultProperties', createObject('keyName', parameters('customerManagedKey').keyName, 'keyVaultResourceId', extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'keyVaultResourceId'), '/')[2], split(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'keyVaultResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults', last(split(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'keyVaultResourceId'), '/'))), 'keyVaultUri', reference('cMKKeyVault').vaultUri)), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Azure NetApp Files Backup Policy
metadata.description: This module deploys a Backup Policy for Azure NetApp File.
Conditional. The name of the parent NetApp account. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the backup policy.
Optional. The location of the backup policy.
Optional. The daily backups to keep. Note, the maximum hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly backup retention counts _combined_ is 1019 (this parameter's max).
Optional. The monthly backups to keep. Note, the maximum hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly backup retention counts _combined_ is 1019 (this parameter's max).
Optional. The weekly backups to keep. Note, the maximum hourly, daily, weekly, and monthly backup retention counts _combined_ is 1019 (this parameter's max).
Optional. Indicates whether the backup policy is enabled.
The resource IDs of the backup Policy created within volume.
The name of the Backup Policy.
The name of the Resource Group the Backup Policy was created in.

metadata.name: Azure NetApp Files Capacity Pools
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure NetApp Files Capacity Pool.
Required. The name of the pool volume.
Optional. If enabled (true) the pool can contain cool Access enabled volumes.
Optional. Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered.
Optional. Determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes (Default/Never/Read).

Optional. The pool service level. Must match the one of the parent capacity pool.
Optional. Network feature for the volume.

Optional. A unique file path for the volume. This is the name of the volume export. A volume is mounted using the export path. File path must start with an alphabetical character and be unique within the subscription.
Required. Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes.
Optional. Set of protocol types. Default value is `['NFSv3']`. If you are creating a dual-stack volume, set either `['NFSv3','CIFS']` or `['NFSv4.1','CIFS']`.
